text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Obara was born in Towada on September 4, 1990. After graduating from Tokiwagi Gakuen High School, she joined Albirex Niigata in 2009. She played 146 matches for the club in 10 seasons. In 2019, she moved to NHK Spring Yokohama FC Seagulls. In July 2010, Obara was selected the Japan U-20 national team for 2010 U-20 World Cup. In May 2014, she was selected the Japan national team for 2014 Asian Cup. At this competition, on May 18, she debuted against Jordan. Japan won the championship. ==Statistics== List of match in 2014 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2014 1 0 Total 1 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Aomori Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Albirex Niigata Ladies players Category:2014 AFC Women's Asian Cup players Category:AFC Women's Asian Cup-winning players
title: Yuria Obara
